poem:
Speaking in Schools

Words dance unheard,  
lost in chalk-clouded air.  
Silent tongues  
behind desks of oak  
yearn for release.  
Teach them to speak—  
wisdom in breath,  
truth in sound—  
open mouths like spring  
with voices sharp as  
pencil tips,  
ready to carve their worlds anew.
